We are needing to animate a Metahuman face in real time, streaming live link data from Nvidia Audio 2 Face, but take control of the eyes through the use of blueprints at the same time. Both are set up, however do not play at the same time.

Current method of ideas are:
Control Rig in animation blueprint seem to override any facial animation prior to its usage. You might have explore if its possible to filter/mask some of the controls in control rig so that animation from a prior source is not affected.

You will have to directly manipulate the bones, in this case your can create a Blend Mask on skeletal mesh and use Layered Blend per Bone to separate out the two animations.

Use pose assets and pose driver to trigger and drive the eye animation.

If you think you can help, please get in touch as this is a paid opportunity.

The total number of registered users for our games exceeds 1 billion worldwide. We develop and release games for PC, consoles, and mobile platforms. Currently, we are looking for a Technical Level Designer for one of the studio's leading projects - SPINE.

SPINE is made with Unreal Engine 5 and centered around cinematic gun-fu shootouts. It's a third-person beat'em'up with a full set of PC gaming features, including a deep storyline, a unique setting, cutscenes, intriguing enemies, memorable bosses, character progression, and, most importantly, breathtaking battles with a wide array of firearms.

This project represents a new ambitious challenge for the company as it marks our first game for both PC and consoles.
